BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: LUTHERAN HOMES OF SOUTH CAROLINA INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: PROMOTE THE WELL-BEING OF OLDER ADULTS BY PROVIDING RESIDENTIAL, HEALTH CARE AND HOSPICE SERVICES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: LUTHERAN HOMES OF SC OPERATES AS A MINISTRY OF THE SC SYNOD OF THE EVANGELICAL LUTHERAN CHURCH IN AMERICA TO PROMOTE THE WELL-BEING OF OLDER ADULTS BY PROVIDING RESIDENTIAL, HEALTH CARE, AND HOSPICE SERVICES.
IRS990.Desc: CONTINUING CARE RETIREMENT COMMUNITYLUTHERAN HOMES SERVED 3,347 RESIDENTS BY PROVIDING 253 ACTIVE LIFESTYLE HOMES, DUPLEXES AND APARTMENTS, 152 INDEPENDENT LIVING RENTAL APARTMENTS, 227 ASSISTED-LIVING UNITS, 81 ASSISTED-LIVING SUPPORT UNITS, 14 SKILLED NURSING MEMORY SUPPORT BEDS, AND 346 SKILLED NURSING BEDS. A GRANT PROGRAM WITH ITS AFFILIATED FOUNDATION SUBSIDIZES 43 RESIDENTS WHO WERE UNABLE TO PAY FULL CHARGES OR QUALIFY FOR GOVERNMENT ASSISTANCE. LUTHERAN PROVIDES A CONTINUUM OF CARE TO ITS RESIDENT AT MULTIPLE SITES, INCLUDING AT FRANKE AT SEASIDE, HERITAGE AT LOWMAN, RICE ESTATE, ROSECREST, TRINITY ON LAURENS, LUTHERAN HOSPICE, AND BEWELL HOME SERVICES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: HOSPICE LUTHERAN HOMES PROVIDED CARE FOR APPROXIMATELY 509 TERMINALLY ILL PATIENTS AND OVER 1,527 FAMILY MEMBERS AND CAREGIVERS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: HOME SERVICESLUTHERAN HOMES PROVIDED IN-HOME SUPPORTIVE SERVICES FOR 619 INDIVIDUALS AND THEIR FAMILIES. LUTHERAN ALSO PROVIDED SUPPORTIVE WELLNESS SERVICES FOR 36 MEMBERS.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: BOARD MEMBER - CUR. (FMR VP OF HR)

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE LUTHERAN HOMES OF SOUTH CAROLINA, INC. AND LUTHERAN HOMES OF SOUTH CAROLINA FOUNDATION, INC. AS DESCRIBED IN SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE ARE EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES ON RELATED INCOME PURSUANT TO SECTION 501(A) OF THE CODE, AND ARE NOT CLASSIFIED AS A PRIVATE FOUNDATION. LUTHERAN SERVICES, INC., A TAXABLE CORPORATION, UTILIZES THE LIABILITY METHOD OF ACCOUNTING FOR INCOME TAXES IN ACCORDANCE WITH STANDARDS ON ACCOUNTING FOR INCOME TAXES. THE ORGANIZATION HAS DETERMINED THAT IT DOES NOT HAVE ANY MATERIAL UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS OR OBLIGATIONS AS OF SEPTEMBER 30, 2018.

RltdOrgOfficerTrstKeyEmplGrp.TitleTxt: BOARD MEMBER - CUR. (FMR VP OF HR)

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PARKE B. HORTON AND FRANK SHEPKE PARTICIPATED IN A SUPPLEMENTAL NONQUALIFIED RETIREMENT PLAN (457F). MANAGEMENT TEAM ALSO PARTICIPATES IN A 457B PLAN WITH A MATCH OF UP TO 4% OF SALARY. OFFICERS RECEIVE A MATCH OF 6% OF SALARY. PEARL MITCHELL RECEIVED DISTRIBUTIONS OF $260,351 FROM A 457 PLAN

THE ORGANIZATION HAS A BOARD APPROVED INCENTIVE PROGRAM. THE INCENTIVE AMOUNTS ARE BASED ON ACHIEVING VARIOUS QUALITY AND FINANCIAL MEASUREMENTS. THE FINANCIAL MEASUREMENTS INCLUDE ACHIEVING THE BUDGET, DEBT COVERAGE RATIO, AND NET OPERATING MARGIN RATIO.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE J PART II / CORE FORM PART VII
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PEARL MITCHELL IS A FORMER TOP 5 HIGHEST PAID EMPLOYEE AND COMPENSATION REPORTED IS FOR THESE SERVICES. SHE CURRENTLY IS A BOARD MEMBER OF THE ORGANIZATION AND IS REPORTED ON PART VII AS SUCH.

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: REFINANCE PORTION OF 1998 SERIES AND CONSTRUCTION SNF

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: LUTHERAN HOMES OF SOUTH CAROLINA INC

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A CHANGE WAS MADE TO THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS FOR THE SELECTION AND NUMBER OF BOARD MEMBERS. PREVIOUSLY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES WAS COMPRISED OF 15 MEMBER, OF WHICH EIGHT WERE APPOINTED BY THE SOUTH CAROLINA SYNOD, SEVEN MEMBERS WERE APPOINTED BY THE INCUMBENT LUTHERAN HOMES BOARD OF TRUSTEES, AND THE BISHOP OF THE SOUTH CAROLINA SYNOD SERVED AS A VOTING MEMBER. NOW THE BOARD IS COMPRISED OF A MINIMUM OF SEVEN AND A MAXIMUM OF TWELVE MEMBERS, OF WHICH TWO MEMBERS ARE RATIFIED BY THE EVANGELICAL LUTHERAN CHURCH IN AMERICA (ELCA) SOUTH CAROLINA SYNOD COUNCIL ANNUALLY, THE BOARD MEMBERS WILL BE LUTHERAN OR OF CHRISTIAN FAITH THAT ARE IN COMMUNION WITH ELCA AND THE BISHOP OF DESIGNEE OF THE SOUTH CAROLINA SYNOD SERVES AS A VOTING MEMBER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EIGHT MEMBERS ARE APPOINTED BY INCUMBENT BOARD. EIGHT MEMBERS ARE APPOINTED BY THE SYNOD IN WHICH THE BISHOP OF THE SC SYNOD IS A VOTING MEMBER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD FINANCE COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE FORM 990 PRIOR TO FILING AND THE FULL BOARD IS PROVIDED A COPY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL OFFICERS, KEY EMPLOPYEES, AND TRUSTEES COMPLETE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE FORM ANNUALLY. TRUSTEES DO NOT VOTE IN MATTERS WHERE CONFLICT EXISTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FOR THE CEO, COMPENSATION IS BASED ON A REVIEW OF SURVEY INFORMATION AND STUDIES ANNUALLY. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE REVIEWS THIS INFORMATION AND RECCOMENDS THE SALARY OF THE CEO TO THE FULL BOARD FOR APPROVAL. FOR OTHER OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES, THE CEO DETERMINES THEIR COMPENSATION BASED ON SALARY SURVEY INFORMATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
PURCHASED SERVICES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 8,676,423. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 109,594. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 8,786,017.
THIS PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
